name: Kepler-251
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-251 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-251 is a star with 0.785 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.89 times its radius. It is located 3095.16 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-251 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-251 b

Kepler-251 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.79 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-251.

The mass of Kepler-251 b is 1.92 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-251 b is 1.33 that of Earth. At 1.92 Earth masses, Kepler-251 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-251 c

Kepler-251 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.51 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-251.

The mass of Kepler-251 c is 11.08 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-251 c is 2.77 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-251 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-251 d

Kepler-251 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 30.13 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-251.

The mass of Kepler-251 d is 11.08 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-251 d is 2.77 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-251 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-251 e

Kepler-251 e was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 99.64 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-251.

The mass of Kepler-251 e is 11.08 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-251 e is 2.77 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-251 e is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-251, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
